title: (x) Martha Stewart Weddings Typefaces / Fine humanist sans - Mundo Sans Extra Light {Dan P}
content:
Does anyone know the name of the typeface used in Martha Stewart Wedding magazine recent issue. It looks like Hoefler & Frere-Jones' Whitney but some letters are not. Is this custom font? Many thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [MS\_Weddings.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20120305231648/http:/typophile.com/files/MS_Weddings.gif) | 24.51 KB |
author: Taiwanese

comments.content:
There are few upper case letters in your sample. If you have an M, G and R, the [Sans Serif Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20120305231648/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/SansGuide/sanssearch.php) might help, or Identifont could be worth a try. It is at its best for text faces like this.

- Mike Yanega
Thank you so much Mike. But I didn’t get result from that.

On the Hoeffler & Frere-Jones' website it lists Martha Stewart Weddings as a [client they've worked with to develop custom typography.](http://web.archive.org/web/20120305231648/http:/www.typography.com/about/clients.php)
Thanks much Minimalista. I emailed them [both] but didn’t get the result. If I am not mistaken, that’s custom-made fonts and not release to public yet.

Even Martha Stewart acquires regular, publicly available fonts every once in a while, just like everybody else. The font in the sample is [Mundo Sans Extra Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20120305231648/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/mundo-sans/extra-light/).
Thank you so much Danpetter! Much appreciated. That’s it! Your suggestion help immensely.
